35#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
36#include <sys/cdefs.h>
37__FBSDID("$FreeBSD: head/sys/netinet/sctp.h 366750 2020-10-16 10:44:48Z tuexen $");

39
40#ifndef _NETINET_SCTP_H_
41#define _NETINET_SCTP_H_
42
43#if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__linux__)
44#include <stdint.h>
45#endif
46#include <sys/types.h>
47
48#if !defined(_WIN32)
49#define SCTP_PACKED __attribute__((packed))
50#else
51#pragma pack (push, 1)
52#define SCTP_PACKED
53#endif
54
55/*
56 * SCTP protocol - RFC4960.
57 */
58struct sctphdr {
59 uint16_t src_port; /* source port */
60 uint16_t dest_port; /* destination port */
61 uint32_t v_tag; /* verification tag of packet */
62 uint32_t checksum; /* CRC32C checksum */
63 /* chunks follow... */
64} SCTP_PACKED;
65
66/*
67 * SCTP Chunks
68 */
69struct sctp_chunkhdr {
70 uint8_t chunk_type; /* chunk type */
71 uint8_t chunk_flags; /* chunk flags */
72 uint16_t chunk_length; /* chunk length */
73 /* optional params follow */
74} SCTP_PACKED;
75
76/*
77 * SCTP chunk parameters
78 */
79struct sctp_paramhdr {
80 uint16_t param_type; /* parameter type */
81 uint16_t param_length; /* parameter length */
82} SCTP_PACKED;
83
84/*
85 * user socket options: socket API defined
86 */
87/*
88 * read-write options
89 */
90#define SCTP_RTOINFO 0x00000001
91#define SCTP_ASSOCINFO 0x00000002
92#define SCTP_INITMSG 0x00000003
93#define SCTP_NODELAY 0x00000004
94#define SCTP_AUTOCLOSE 0x00000005
95#define SCTP_SET_PEER_PRIMARY_ADDR 0x00000006
96#define SCTP_PRIMARY_ADDR 0x00000007
97#define SCTP_ADAPTATION_LAYER 0x00000008
98/* same as above */
99#define SCTP_ADAPTION_LAYER 0x00000008
100#define SCTP_DISABLE_FRAGMENTS 0x00000009
101#define SCTP_PEER_ADDR_PARAMS 0x0000000a
102#define SCTP_DEFAULT_SEND_PARAM 0x0000000b
103/* ancillary data/notification interest options */
104#define SCTP_EVENTS 0x0000000c /* deprecated */
105/* Without this applied we will give V4 and V6 addresses on a V6 socket */
106#define SCTP_I_WANT_MAPPED_V4_ADDR 0x0000000d
107#define SCTP_MAXSEG 0x0000000e
108#define SCTP_DELAYED_SACK 0x0000000f
109#define SCTP_FRAGMENT_INTERLEAVE 0x00000010
110#define SCTP_PARTIAL_DELIVERY_POINT 0x00000011
111/* authentication support */
112#define SCTP_AUTH_CHUNK 0x00000012
113#define SCTP_AUTH_KEY 0x00000013
114#define SCTP_HMAC_IDENT 0x00000014
115#define SCTP_AUTH_ACTIVE_KEY 0x00000015
116#define SCTP_AUTH_DELETE_KEY 0x00000016
117#define SCTP_USE_EXT_RCVINFO 0x00000017
118#define SCTP_AUTO_ASCONF 0x00000018 /* rw */
119#define SCTP_MAXBURST 0x00000019 /* rw */
120#define SCTP_MAX_BURST 0x00000019 /* rw */
121/* assoc level context */
122#define SCTP_CONTEXT 0x0000001a /* rw */
123/* explicit EOR signalling */
124#define SCTP_EXPLICIT_EOR 0x0000001b
125#define SCTP_REUSE_PORT 0x0000001c /* rw */
126#define SCTP_AUTH_DEACTIVATE_KEY 0x0000001d
127#define SCTP_EVENT 0x0000001e
128#define SCTP_RECVRCVINFO 0x0000001f
129#define SCTP_RECVNXTINFO 0x00000020
130#define SCTP_DEFAULT_SNDINFO 0x00000021
131#define SCTP_DEFAULT_PRINFO 0x00000022
132#define SCTP_PEER_ADDR_THLDS 0x00000023
133#define SCTP_REMOTE_UDP_ENCAPS_PORT 0x00000024
134#define SCTP_ECN_SUPPORTED 0x00000025
135#define SCTP_PR_SUPPORTED 0x00000026
136#define SCTP_AUTH_SUPPORTED 0x00000027
137#define SCTP_ASCONF_SUPPORTED 0x00000028
138#define SCTP_RECONFIG_SUPPORTED 0x00000029
139#define SCTP_NRSACK_SUPPORTED 0x00000030
140#define SCTP_PKTDROP_SUPPORTED 0x00000031
141#define SCTP_MAX_CWND 0x00000032
142
143/*
144 * read-only options
145 */
146#define SCTP_STATUS 0x00000100
147#define SCTP_GET_PEER_ADDR_INFO 0x00000101
148/* authentication support */
149#define SCTP_PEER_AUTH_CHUNKS 0x00000102
150#define SCTP_LOCAL_AUTH_CHUNKS 0x00000103
151#define SCTP_GET_ASSOC_NUMBER 0x00000104 /* ro */
152#define SCTP_GET_ASSOC_ID_LIST 0x00000105 /* ro */
153#define SCTP_TIMEOUTS 0x00000106
154#define SCTP_PR_STREAM_STATUS 0x00000107
155#define SCTP_PR_ASSOC_STATUS 0x00000108
156
157/*
158 * user socket options: BSD implementation specific
159 */
160/*
161 * Blocking I/O is enabled on any TCP type socket by default. For the UDP
162 * model if this is turned on then the socket buffer is shared for send
163 * resources amongst all associations. The default for the UDP model is that
164 * is SS_NBIO is set. Which means all associations have a separate send
165 * limit BUT they will NOT ever BLOCK instead you will get an error back
166 * EAGAIN if you try to send too much. If you want the blocking semantics you
167 * set this option at the cost of sharing one socket send buffer size amongst
168 * all associations. Peeled off sockets turn this option off and block. But
169 * since both TCP and peeled off sockets have only one assoc per socket this
170 * is fine. It probably does NOT make sense to set this on SS_NBIO on a TCP
171 * model OR peeled off UDP model, but we do allow you to do so. You just use
172 * the normal syscall to toggle SS_NBIO the way you want.
173 *
174 * Blocking I/O is controlled by the SS_NBIO flag on the socket state so_state
175 * field.
176 */
177
178#define SCTP_ENABLE_STREAM_RESET 0x00000900 /* struct sctp_assoc_value */
179#define SCTP_RESET_STREAMS 0x00000901 /* struct sctp_reset_streams */
180#define SCTP_RESET_ASSOC 0x00000902 /* sctp_assoc_t */
181#define SCTP_ADD_STREAMS 0x00000903 /* struct sctp_add_streams */
182
183/* For enable stream reset */
184#define SCTP_ENABLE_RESET_STREAM_REQ 0x00000001
185#define SCTP_ENABLE_RESET_ASSOC_REQ 0x00000002
186#define SCTP_ENABLE_CHANGE_ASSOC_REQ 0x00000004
187#define SCTP_ENABLE_VALUE_MASK 0x00000007
188/* For reset streams */
189#define SCTP_STREAM_RESET_INCOMING 0x00000001
190#define SCTP_STREAM_RESET_OUTGOING 0x00000002
191
192/* here on down are more implementation specific */
193#define SCTP_SET_DEBUG_LEVEL 0x00001005
194#define SCTP_CLR_STAT_LOG 0x00001007
195/* CMT ON/OFF socket option */
196#define SCTP_CMT_ON_OFF 0x00001200
197#define SCTP_CMT_USE_DAC 0x00001201
198/* JRS - Pluggable Congestion Control Socket option */
199#define SCTP_PLUGGABLE_CC 0x00001202
200/* RS - Pluggable Stream Scheduling Socket option */
201#define SCTP_PLUGGABLE_SS 0x00001203
202#define SCTP_SS_VALUE 0x00001204
203#define SCTP_CC_OPTION 0x00001205 /* Options for CC modules */
204/* For I-DATA */
205#define SCTP_INTERLEAVING_SUPPORTED 0x00001206
206
207/* read only */
208#define SCTP_GET_SNDBUF_USE 0x00001101
209#define SCTP_GET_STAT_LOG 0x00001103
210#define SCTP_PCB_STATUS 0x00001104
211#define SCTP_GET_NONCE_VALUES 0x00001105
212
213/* Special hook for dynamically setting primary for all assoc's,
214 * this is a write only option that requires root privilege.
215 */
216#define SCTP_SET_DYNAMIC_PRIMARY 0x00002001
217
218/* VRF (virtual router feature) and multi-VRF support
219 * options. VRF's provide splits within a router
220 * that give the views of multiple routers. A
221 * standard host, without VRF support, is just
222 * a single VRF. If VRF's are supported then
223 * the transport must be VRF aware. This means
224 * that every socket call coming in must be directed
225 * within the endpoint to one of the VRF's it belongs
226 * to. The endpoint, before binding, may select
227 * the "default" VRF it is in by using a set socket
228 * option with SCTP_VRF_ID. This will also
229 * get propagated to the default VRF. Once the
230 * endpoint binds an address then it CANNOT add
231 * additional VRF's to become a Multi-VRF endpoint.
232 *
233 * Before BINDING additional VRF's can be added with
234 * the SCTP_ADD_VRF_ID call or deleted with
235 * SCTP_DEL_VRF_ID.
236 *
237 * Associations are ALWAYS contained inside a single
238 * VRF. They cannot reside in two (or more) VRF's. Incoming
239 * packets, assuming the router is VRF aware, can always
240 * tell us what VRF they arrived on. A host not supporting
241 * any VRF's will find that the packets always arrived on the
242 * single VRF that the host has.
243 *
244 */
245
246#define SCTP_VRF_ID 0x00003001
247#define SCTP_ADD_VRF_ID 0x00003002
248#define SCTP_GET_VRF_IDS 0x00003003
249#define SCTP_GET_ASOC_VRF 0x00003004
250#define SCTP_DEL_VRF_ID 0x00003005
251
252/*
253 * If you enable packet logging you can get
254 * a poor mans ethereal output in binary
255 * form. Note this is a compile option to
256 * the kernel, SCTP_PACKET_LOGGING, and
257 * without it in your kernel you
258 * will get a EOPNOTSUPP
259 */
260#define SCTP_GET_PACKET_LOG 0x00004001
261
262/*
263 * hidden implementation specific options these are NOT user visible (should
264 * move out of sctp.h)
265 */
266/* sctp_bindx() flags as hidden socket options */
267#define SCTP_BINDX_ADD_ADDR 0x00008001
268#define SCTP_BINDX_REM_ADDR 0x00008002
269/* Hidden socket option that gets the addresses */
270#define SCTP_GET_PEER_ADDRESSES 0x00008003
271#define SCTP_GET_LOCAL_ADDRESSES 0x00008004
272/* return the total count in bytes needed to hold all local addresses bound */
273#define SCTP_GET_LOCAL_ADDR_SIZE 0x00008005
274/* Return the total count in bytes needed to hold the remote address */
275#define SCTP_GET_REMOTE_ADDR_SIZE 0x00008006
276/* hidden option for connectx */
277#define SCTP_CONNECT_X 0x00008007
278/* hidden option for connectx_delayed, part of sendx */
279#define SCTP_CONNECT_X_DELAYED 0x00008008
280#define SCTP_CONNECT_X_COMPLETE 0x00008009
281/* hidden socket option based sctp_peeloff */
282#define SCTP_PEELOFF 0x0000800a
283/* the real worker for sctp_getaddrlen() */
284#define SCTP_GET_ADDR_LEN 0x0000800b
285#if defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
286/* temporary workaround for Apple listen() issue, no args used */
287#define SCTP_LISTEN_FIX 0x0000800c
288#endif
289#if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__Userspace__)
290/* workaround for Cygwin on Windows: returns the SOCKET handle */
291#define SCTP_GET_HANDLE 0x0000800d
292#endif
293/* Debug things that need to be purged */
294#define SCTP_SET_INITIAL_DBG_SEQ 0x00009f00
295
296/* JRS - Supported congestion control modules for pluggable
297 * congestion control
298 */
299/* Standard TCP Congestion Control */
300#define SCTP_CC_RFC2581 0x00000000
301/* High Speed TCP Congestion Control (Floyd) */
302#define SCTP_CC_HSTCP 0x00000001
303/* HTCP Congestion Control */
304#define SCTP_CC_HTCP 0x00000002
305/* RTCC Congestion Control - RFC2581 plus */
306#define SCTP_CC_RTCC 0x00000003
307
308#define SCTP_CC_OPT_RTCC_SETMODE 0x00002000
309#define SCTP_CC_OPT_USE_DCCC_ECN 0x00002001
310#define SCTP_CC_OPT_STEADY_STEP 0x00002002
311
312#define SCTP_CMT_OFF 0
313#define SCTP_CMT_BASE 1
314#define SCTP_CMT_RPV1 2
315#define SCTP_CMT_RPV2 3
316#define SCTP_CMT_MPTCP 4
317#define SCTP_CMT_MAX SCTP_CMT_MPTCP
318
319/* RS - Supported stream scheduling modules for pluggable
320 * stream scheduling
321 */
322/* Default simple round-robin */
323#define SCTP_SS_DEFAULT 0x00000000
324/* Real round-robin */
325#define SCTP_SS_ROUND_ROBIN 0x00000001
326/* Real round-robin per packet */
327#define SCTP_SS_ROUND_ROBIN_PACKET 0x00000002
328/* Priority */
329#define SCTP_SS_PRIORITY 0x00000003
330/* Fair Bandwidth */
331#define SCTP_SS_FAIR_BANDWITH 0x00000004
332/* First-come, first-serve */
333#define SCTP_SS_FIRST_COME 0x00000005
334
335/* fragment interleave constants
336 * setting must be one of these or
337 * EINVAL returned.
338 */
339#define SCTP_FRAG_LEVEL_0 0x00000000
340#define SCTP_FRAG_LEVEL_1 0x00000001
341#define SCTP_FRAG_LEVEL_2 0x00000002
342
343/*
344 * user state values
345 */
346#define SCTP_CLOSED 0x0000
347#define SCTP_BOUND 0x1000
348#define SCTP_LISTEN 0x2000
349#define SCTP_COOKIE_WAIT 0x0002
350#define SCTP_COOKIE_ECHOED 0x0004
351#define SCTP_ESTABLISHED 0x0008
352#define SCTP_SHUTDOWN_SENT 0x0010
353#define SCTP_SHUTDOWN_RECEIVED 0x0020
354#define SCTP_SHUTDOWN_ACK_SENT 0x0040
355#define SCTP_SHUTDOWN_PENDING 0x0080
356
357/*
358 * SCTP operational error codes (user visible)
359 */
360#define SCTP_CAUSE_NO_ERROR 0x0000
361#define SCTP_CAUSE_INVALID_STREAM 0x0001
362#define SCTP_CAUSE_MISSING_PARAM 0x0002
363#define SCTP_CAUSE_STALE_COOKIE 0x0003
364#define SCTP_CAUSE_OUT_OF_RESC 0x0004
365#define SCTP_CAUSE_UNRESOLVABLE_ADDR 0x0005
366#define SCTP_CAUSE_UNRECOG_CHUNK 0x0006
367#define SCTP_CAUSE_INVALID_PARAM 0x0007
368#define SCTP_CAUSE_UNRECOG_PARAM 0x0008
369#define SCTP_CAUSE_NO_USER_DATA 0x0009
370#define SCTP_CAUSE_COOKIE_IN_SHUTDOWN 0x000a
371#define SCTP_CAUSE_RESTART_W_NEWADDR 0x000b
372#define SCTP_CAUSE_USER_INITIATED_ABT 0x000c
373#define SCTP_CAUSE_PROTOCOL_VIOLATION 0x000d
374
375/* Error causes from RFC5061 */
376#define SCTP_CAUSE_DELETING_LAST_ADDR 0x00a0
377#define SCTP_CAUSE_RESOURCE_SHORTAGE 0x00a1
378#define SCTP_CAUSE_DELETING_SRC_ADDR 0x00a2
379#define SCTP_CAUSE_ILLEGAL_ASCONF_ACK 0x00a3
380#define SCTP_CAUSE_REQUEST_REFUSED 0x00a4
381
382/* Error causes from nat-draft */
383#define SCTP_CAUSE_NAT_COLLIDING_STATE 0x00b0
384#define SCTP_CAUSE_NAT_MISSING_STATE 0x00b1
385
386/* Error causes from RFC4895 */
387#define SCTP_CAUSE_UNSUPPORTED_HMACID 0x0105
388
389/*
390 * error cause parameters (user visible)
391 */
392struct sctp_gen_error_cause {
393 uint16_t code;
394 uint16_t length;
395 uint8_t info[];
396} SCTP_PACKED;
397
398struct sctp_error_cause {
399 uint16_t code;
400 uint16_t length;
401 /* optional cause-specific info may follow */
402} SCTP_PACKED;
403
404struct sctp_error_invalid_stream {
405 struct sctp_error_cause cause; /* code=SCTP_CAUSE_INVALID_STREAM */
406 uint16_t stream_id; /* stream id of the DATA in error */
407 uint16_t reserved;
408} SCTP_PACKED;
409
410struct sctp_error_missing_param {
411 struct sctp_error_cause cause; /* code=SCTP_CAUSE_MISSING_PARAM */
412 uint32_t num_missing_params; /* number of missing parameters */
413 uint16_t type[];
414} SCTP_PACKED;
415
416struct sctp_error_stale_cookie {
417 struct sctp_error_cause cause; /* code=SCTP_CAUSE_STALE_COOKIE */
418 uint32_t stale_time; /* time in usec of staleness */
419} SCTP_PACKED;
420
421struct sctp_error_out_of_resource {
422 struct sctp_error_cause cause; /* code=SCTP_CAUSE_OUT_OF_RESOURCES */
423} SCTP_PACKED;
424
425struct sctp_error_unresolv_addr {
426 struct sctp_error_cause cause; /* code=SCTP_CAUSE_UNRESOLVABLE_ADDR */
427} SCTP_PACKED;
428
429struct sctp_error_unrecognized_chunk {
430 struct sctp_error_cause cause; /* code=SCTP_CAUSE_UNRECOG_CHUNK */
431 struct sctp_chunkhdr ch;/* header from chunk in error */
432} SCTP_PACKED;
433
434struct sctp_error_no_user_data {
435 struct sctp_error_cause cause; /* code=SCTP_CAUSE_NO_USER_DATA */
436 uint32_t tsn; /* TSN of the empty data chunk */
437} SCTP_PACKED;
438
439struct sctp_error_auth_invalid_hmac {
440 struct sctp_error_cause cause; /* code=SCTP_CAUSE_UNSUPPORTED_HMACID */
441 uint16_t hmac_id;
442} SCTP_PACKED;
443
444/*
445 * Main SCTP chunk types we place these here so natd and f/w's in user land
446 * can find them.
447 */
448/************0x00 series ***********/
449#define SCTP_DATA 0x00
450#define SCTP_INITIATION 0x01
451#define SCTP_INITIATION_ACK 0x02
452#define SCTP_SELECTIVE_ACK 0x03
453#define SCTP_HEARTBEAT_REQUEST 0x04
454#define SCTP_HEARTBEAT_ACK 0x05
455#define SCTP_ABORT_ASSOCIATION 0x06
456#define SCTP_SHUTDOWN 0x07
457#define SCTP_SHUTDOWN_ACK 0x08
458#define SCTP_OPERATION_ERROR 0x09
459#define SCTP_COOKIE_ECHO 0x0a
460#define SCTP_COOKIE_ACK 0x0b
461#define SCTP_ECN_ECHO 0x0c
462#define SCTP_ECN_CWR 0x0d
463#define SCTP_SHUTDOWN_COMPLETE 0x0e
464/* RFC4895 */
465#define SCTP_AUTHENTICATION 0x0f
466/* EY nr_sack chunk id*/
467#define SCTP_NR_SELECTIVE_ACK 0x10
468/************0x40 series ***********/
469#define SCTP_IDATA 0x40
470/************0x80 series ***********/
471/* RFC5061 */
472#define SCTP_ASCONF_ACK 0x80
473/* draft-ietf-stewart-pktdrpsctp */
474#define SCTP_PACKET_DROPPED 0x81
475/* draft-ietf-stewart-strreset-xxx */
476#define SCTP_STREAM_RESET 0x82
477
478/* RFC4820 */
479#define SCTP_PAD_CHUNK 0x84
480/************0xc0 series ***********/
481/* RFC3758 */
482#define SCTP_FORWARD_CUM_TSN 0xc0
483/* RFC5061 */
484#define SCTP_ASCONF 0xc1
485#define SCTP_IFORWARD_CUM_TSN 0xc2
486
487/* ABORT and SHUTDOWN COMPLETE FLAG */
488#define SCTP_HAD_NO_TCB 0x01
489
490/* Packet dropped flags */
491#define SCTP_FROM_MIDDLE_BOX SCTP_HAD_NO_TCB
492#define SCTP_BADCRC 0x02
493#define SCTP_PACKET_TRUNCATED 0x04
494
495/* Flag for ECN -CWR */
496#define SCTP_CWR_REDUCE_OVERRIDE 0x01
497#define SCTP_CWR_IN_SAME_WINDOW 0x02
498
499#define SCTP_SAT_NETWORK_MIN 400 /* min ms for RTT to set satellite
500 * time */
501#define SCTP_SAT_NETWORK_BURST_INCR 2 /* how many times to multiply maxburst
502 * in sat */
503
504/* Data Chuck Specific Flags */
505#define SCTP_DATA_FRAG_MASK 0x03
506#define SCTP_DATA_MIDDLE_FRAG 0x00
507#define SCTP_DATA_LAST_FRAG 0x01
508#define SCTP_DATA_FIRST_FRAG 0x02
509#define SCTP_DATA_NOT_FRAG 0x03
510#define SCTP_DATA_UNORDERED 0x04
511#define SCTP_DATA_SACK_IMMEDIATELY 0x08
512/* ECN Nonce: SACK Chunk Specific Flags */
513#define SCTP_SACK_NONCE_SUM 0x01
514
515/* CMT DAC algorithm SACK flag */
516#define SCTP_SACK_CMT_DAC 0x80
517
518/*
519 * PCB flags (in sctp_flags bitmask).
520 * Note the features and flags are meant
521 * for use by netstat.
522 */
523#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_UDPTYPE 0x00000001
524#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_TCPTYPE 0x00000002
525#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUNDALL 0x00000004
526#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_ACCEPTING 0x00000008
527#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_UNBOUND 0x00000010
528#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_SND_ITERATOR_UP 0x00000020
529#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_CLOSE_IP 0x00040000
530#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAS_CONNECTED 0x00080000
531#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAS_ABORTED 0x00100000
532/* TCP model support */
533
534#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_CONNECTED 0x00200000
535#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_IN_TCPPOOL 0x00400000
536#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DONT_WAKE 0x00800000
537#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAKEOUTPUT 0x01000000
538#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAKEINPUT 0x02000000
539#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_V6 0x04000000
540#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BLOCKING_IO 0x08000000
541#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_SOCKET_GONE 0x10000000
542#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_SOCKET_ALLGONE 0x20000000
543#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_SOCKET_CANT_READ 0x40000000
544#if defined(__Userspace__)
545#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_CONN 0x80000000
546
547/* flags to copy to new PCB */
548#define SCTP_PCB_COPY_FLAGS (SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUNDALL|\
549 SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAKEINPUT|\
550 SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_V6|\
551 SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_CONN)
552#else
553
554/* flags to copy to new PCB */
555#define SCTP_PCB_COPY_FLAGS (SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUNDALL|\
556 SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAKEINPUT|\
557 SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_V6)
558#endif
559
560/*
561 * PCB Features (in sctp_features bitmask)
562 */
563#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DO_NOT_PMTUD 0x0000000000000001
564#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_EXT_RCVINFO 0x0000000000000002 /* deprecated */
565#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DONOT_HEARTBEAT 0x0000000000000004
566#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_FRAG_INTERLEAVE 0x0000000000000008
567#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_INTERLEAVE_STRMS 0x0000000000000010
568#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DO_ASCONF 0x0000000000000020
569#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_AUTO_ASCONF 0x0000000000000040
570/* socket options */
571#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_NODELAY 0x0000000000000100
572#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_AUTOCLOSE 0x0000000000000200
573#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_RECVDATAIOEVNT 0x0000000000000400 /* deprecated */
574#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_RECVASSOCEVNT 0x0000000000000800
575#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_RECVPADDREVNT 0x0000000000001000
576#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_RECVPEERERR 0x0000000000002000
577#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_RECVSENDFAILEVNT 0x0000000000004000 /* deprecated */
578#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_RECVSHUTDOWNEVNT 0x0000000000008000
579#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_ADAPTATIONEVNT 0x0000000000010000
580#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_PDAPIEVNT 0x0000000000020000
581#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_AUTHEVNT 0x0000000000040000
582#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_STREAM_RESETEVNT 0x0000000000080000
583#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_NO_FRAGMENT 0x0000000000100000
584#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_EXPLICIT_EOR 0x0000000000400000
585#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_NEEDS_MAPPED_V4 0x0000000000800000
586#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_MULTIPLE_ASCONFS 0x0000000001000000
587#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_PORTREUSE 0x0000000002000000
588#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DRYEVNT 0x0000000004000000
589#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_RECVRCVINFO 0x0000000008000000
590#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_RECVNXTINFO 0x0000000010000000
591#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_ASSOC_RESETEVNT 0x0000000020000000
592#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_STREAM_CHANGEEVNT 0x0000000040000000
593#define SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_RECVNSENDFAILEVNT 0x0000000080000000
594
595/*-
596 * mobility_features parameters (by micchie).Note
597 * these features are applied against the
598 * sctp_mobility_features flags.. not the sctp_features
599 * flags.
600 */
601#define SCTP_MOBILITY_BASE 0x00000001
602#define SCTP_MOBILITY_FASTHANDOFF 0x00000002
603#define SCTP_MOBILITY_PRIM_DELETED 0x00000004
604
605/* Smallest PMTU allowed when disabling PMTU discovery */
606#define SCTP_SMALLEST_PMTU 512
607/* Largest PMTU allowed when disabling PMTU discovery */
608#define SCTP_LARGEST_PMTU 65536
609
610#if defined(_WIN32)
611#pragma pack(pop)
612#endif
613#undef SCTP_PACKED
614
615#include <netinet/sctp_uio.h>
616
617/* This dictates the size of the packet
618 * collection buffer. This only applies
619 * if SCTP_PACKET_LOGGING is enabled in
620 * your config.
621 */
622#define SCTP_PACKET_LOG_SIZE 65536
623
624/* Maximum delays and such a user can set for options that
625 * take ms.
626 */
627#define SCTP_MAX_SACK_DELAY 500 /* per RFC4960 */
628#define SCTP_MAX_HB_INTERVAL 14400000 /* 4 hours in ms */
629#define SCTP_MIN_COOKIE_LIFE 1000 /* 1 second in ms */
630#define SCTP_MAX_COOKIE_LIFE 3600000 /* 1 hour in ms */
631
632/* Types of logging/KTR tracing that can be enabled via the
633 * sysctl net.inet.sctp.sctp_logging. You must also enable
634 * SUBSYS tracing.
635 * Note that you must have the SCTP option in the kernel
636 * to enable these as well.
637 */
638#define SCTP_BLK_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00000001
639#define SCTP_CWND_MONITOR_ENABLE 0x00000002
640#define SCTP_CWND_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00000004
641#define SCTP_FLIGHT_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00000020
642#define SCTP_FR_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00000040
643#define SCTP_LOCK_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00000080
644#define SCTP_MAP_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00000100
645#define SCTP_MBCNT_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00000200
646#define SCTP_MBUF_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00000400
647#define SCTP_NAGLE_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00000800
648#define SCTP_RECV_RWND_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00001000
649#define SCTP_RTTVAR_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00002000
650#define SCTP_SACK_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00004000
651#define SCTP_SACK_RWND_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00008000
652#define SCTP_SB_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00010000
653#define SCTP_STR_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00020000
654#define SCTP_WAKE_LOGGING_ENABLE 0x00040000
655#define SCTP_LOG_MAXBURST_ENABLE 0x00080000
656#define SCTP_LOG_RWND_ENABLE 0x00100000
657#define SCTP_LOG_SACK_ARRIVALS_ENABLE 0x00200000
658#define SCTP_LTRACE_CHUNK_ENABLE 0x00400000
659#define SCTP_LTRACE_ERROR_ENABLE 0x00800000
660#define SCTP_LAST_PACKET_TRACING 0x01000000
661#define SCTP_THRESHOLD_LOGGING 0x02000000
662#define SCTP_LOG_AT_SEND_2_SCTP 0x04000000
663#define SCTP_LOG_AT_SEND_2_OUTQ 0x08000000
664#define SCTP_LOG_TRY_ADVANCE 0x10000000
